snippet: Representatives are divided over what funds the bill should cut and by how much, including food stamps and school lunch programs.
abstract: First major overhaul of the nation’s nutrition and farm program is in jeopardy because of a split in the ranks of House Republicans over the degree of spending cuts; House Republican leaders, fearing a divisive intraparty fight, are considering holding off the farm bill vote until after the November elections.
lead_paragraph: Representatives are divided over what funds the bill should cut and by how much, including food stamps and school lunch programs.

headline.seo: House Republicans Disagree Over Farm Bill Cuts
headline.main: Split Among House Republicans Over How Deeply to Cut May Delay Farm Bill
headline.print_headline: Split Among House Republicans Over How Deeply to Cut May Delay Farm Bill
